item.title: Putting an end to the exploitation of seasonal workers: EU legislation targets the easiest issues.
item.description:
Steve Peers The EU struggled to create legislation regarding migrant workers from outside the EU. Member States finally agreed on laws focused on higher-income migrants: the Blue Card Directive and the Directive on intra-corporate transferees. The EU also established general rules for admitting labor migrants with the single permit Directive. In a new development, the EU introduced rules for lower-paid seasonal workers last year. This group is particularly susceptible to exploitation...
